III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was pushed by Staff 1 during an altercation that occurred
on 05/25/2025.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed during a face-to-face, unannounced visit
to the facility on 05/29/2025. Youth A described the incident in
question beginning because he felt like he had energy in his body
and he wanted to wrestle. Youth A recalled being in the
“dodgeball room” of his unit, which he described as a recreation
area with couches and a television. Youth A was on one side of
the door exiting this room, and Staff 1 was on the other. He felt
like Staff 1 was blocking him from being able to exit the
room. Youth A recalled the door opening and Staff 1 pushing him
in the chest. Youth A believed that this push had enough force to
cause him to fall over. Youth A remembered feeling angry, and he
believed he stood up to try to punch Staff 1. He recalled Staff 1
stating “Don’t do that” to him. Youth A recalled pushing back at
Staff 1 and beginning to yell and curse at him. He recalled Staff 1
calling for a supervisor to come assist. Youth A remembered
Supervisor 1 came and he mostly interacted with him and not Staff
1 after that. Youth A recalled Staff 2 and Youth B also being in
the room when this occurred.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone on 06/26/2025. She
recalled being in the room with Youth B when the incident in
question occurred. She remembered hearing a ruckus from
outside of the room, and the next time she looked up at the door
where the noise was coming from, Staff 1 and Youth A had
entered the room. Staff 2 recalled seeing Youth A attempt to
punch Staff 1. She was not sure if Youth A was successful or
not. Staff 2 did not see either Youth A or Staff 1 put their hands
on the other from that point on. While Youth A was yelling at Staff
1, Staff 2 heard both Staff 1 and Youth A refer to the other
pushing them during the interaction. Staff 1 called for supervisor
help and Youth A moved away from Staff 1 at that point. Staff 2
2

did not attempt to intervene because she had been engaged with
Youth B. Staff 2 denied seeing Staff 1 push Youth A in any form.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone on 06/27/2025. He
recalled the incident in question beginning with Youth A being in
the “dodgeball room” of the unit and Staff 1 attempting to follow
him in there. Staff 1 explained that he was following Youth A to
maintain line of sight as Youth A had begun to show physically
escalated behaviors. Staff 1 was not able to enter the room as
Youth A was holding the other side of the door shut. Staff 1
recalled giving verbal redirection and attempted to de-escalate
Youth A. Staff 1 was able to open the door and as he did, he
recalled Youth A pushing him hard in the chest. Staff 1 recalled
using proximity tactics to attempt to create space between he and
Youth A. He described this further as putting his hands up and
using his hands to create space. He believed he made contact
with Youth A, but denied that this was in an effort to push Youth
A. Staff 1 clarified that any contact with Youth A did not have
force behind it and only occurred as an attempt to move past
Youth A and away from his physically escalated behavior. Staff 1
recalled Youth A getting verbally upset, including threatening to
beat up Staff 1. Youth A then took a swing at Staff 1 but was not
successful. Staff 1 recalled Youth A moving away from him,
despite continuing to be verbally upset at Staff 1. Staff 1 radioed
for supervisor assistance at this point. When Supervisor 1 arrived,
Staff 1 did not have any further interaction with Youth A. Staff 1
recalled interacting with Youth A sometime later that day, and that
interaction included an apology from Youth A and the two playing
a video game together.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone on 07/01/2025. He
recalled reporting to the “dodgeball room” after the incident
occurred. Supervisor 1 spoke with Youth A, and in that
conversation Youth A reported trying to hit Staff 1 and Staff 1
pushing him. When Supervisor 1 spoke with Staff 1 he received a
similar recollection of events, including Staff 1 stating that he had
to “push past” Youth A to get into the room. Supervisor 1 did not
have any further concern over the situation as Youth A had
already begun to calm down when he arrived.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 07/02/2025. She
recalled being present in the “dodgeball room” with Staff 2 when
the incident occurred. Youth B believed the whole interaction
between Staff 1 and Youth A was brief. She saw Youth A push
and try to punch Staff 1. Youth B recalled Staff 1 avoiding these
3

physical attempts, and she stated that she never saw Staff 1 put
his hands on Youth A or try to push him.
Video reviewed:
• Security footage dated 05/25/2025 beginning at 6:32pm
was provided and reviewed. Youth A can be seen entering
the “dodgeball room.” He stood at the inside of the door
and held the door handle. After a few seconds Staff 1
opened the door and Youth A turned outwards to face Staff
1. As they briefly interacted, Youth A then closed the door
again with Staff 1 on the outside of the room. Staff 1 then
opened the door again and Youth A turned again to face
Staff 1. As he did this both Youth A and Staff 1 had their
hands on each other. Staff 1 pushed Youth A backwards
and Youth A took two to three steps back. Youth A then
swatted at Staff 1 and it could not be determined if he made
contact. Staff 1 could be seen verbally addressing Youth
A, but what was said could not be determined as the
footage did not have audio. Youth A opened the door up
again and Staff 1 stepped away from him. Both Youth A
and Staff 1 could be seen speaking to each other. Staff 1
then walked out of view as Youth A still stood at the
doorway.
Documentation reviewed:
• Incident report documentation from the facility was provided
and reviewed. This was dated 05/25/2025 and authored by
Staff 1. In this documentation he reported Youth A did not
allow Staff 1 to open the door. Staff 1 was able to open the
door and Youth A pushed Staff 1. Staff 1 used haptics to
clear space from Youth A and get in the room. Youth A
threatened Staff 1.
• Personnel file documentation was reviewed and Staff 1
only had one instance of discipline in 2016 for an unrelated
matter and was up to date on facility behavior management
programming.
• Email communication between Supervisor 1 and
administrators at the facility was provided and reviewed. In
an 05/25/2025 email Supervisor 1 stated that Staff 1 had
told him that Youth A “pushed me and I pushed him back”
in the immediate aftermath of the incident. This email
communication also confirmed Staff 1 was removed from
the schedule for the facility as of 05/25/2025.
• Facility policy and procedures titled “Prohibited Practices”
was provided and reviewed. This policy outlined prohibited
acts of staff towards youth, including “Hitting or striking,
4

throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of
their body.”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews, documentation and video reviewed Staff 1 pushed
Youth A during an incident that occurred on 05/25/2025.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR # 2024SIC0001557 dated 9/9/2024, CAP approved 11/4/2024
SIR # 2025SIC0000066 dated 1/30/2025, CAP approved 2/4/2025
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
